page.title: 17The Roman Bridge
page.content: Around half way between Springholm and Haugh of Urr lies an old historical bridge believed to be built by the Romans. Known as Barr Bridge, it is situated on an old drove road which used to exist between The Hermitage and West Glenarm. (The road still exists in rough condition, from West Glenarm, through East Glenarm and eventually out to the Old Military Road south of Milton). Water still flows underneath its stone arch, from Spottes Burn. One side of the bridge is deteriorating badly. The stone from which the bridge was built is shale. Considering its age it is in good condition. The bridge's span is 57ft across. Its width from side to side is 11ft also. Apparently the Roman Bridge had walls on each side but now there is no trace of them.
